Comments_List: I learned the basics of biomedical data, use of electronic health records, transnational informatics and their implications.
It was an excellent course with very good student to instructor ratio. No weakness.

The range of subjects covered and the emphasis on guest instructors and discussions was great.

The midterm shouldn't have been graded so much on having specific key words in the answer, and the grading scale should have been more clearly laid out. The homeworks also didn't really contribute much.
I would recommend this course to anyone in the medical field. This course is the only course at Yale that teaches the basic principles of health informatics.
